>
[Scroll Trickster Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6400) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=572" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 213 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Scroll Trickster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=262)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43), Trained in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), Trained in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44), or Trained in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)

</column>

---

You've studied [scrolls](/Equipment.aspx?Category=52) in depth. This might have been a comprehensive education in a formal setting or the sort of education where you somehow obtain a number of scrolls and try not to explode anything you didn't mean to explode. You gain the [Trick Magic Item](/Feats.aspx?ID=5229) feat, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to skill checks to Trick scrolls. If you roll a critical failure to Trick a Magic Item that's a scroll, you get a failure instead.

<title level="2">Scroll Trickster Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Scroll Cache](/Feats.aspx?ID=6401), [Skim Scroll](/Feats.aspx?ID=6402)
